intro: Pterocephalus siamensis, commonly known as the Siam pterocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. It produces pods that contain small, hard seeds. Pterocephalus siamensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
